definition: public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)
abbr. for 眾議院|众议院[Zhong4 yi4 yuan4], House of Representatives

pinyin: gong1 zhong4 dian4 xin4 wang3 lu4

sentences.english: This congressman is clever at making scores off hecklers at public meetings.
sentences.chinese: 这位国会议员擅长在公众集会上驳倒诘难者。

sentences.english: About 20 percent of the vaccine will be reserved for essential workers and the rest go to the public on a voluntary basis.
sentences.chinese: 有20%的疫苗将供收储，其馀面向公众自愿接种。

sentences.english: This mirrors the situation when we are watching a public figure apologizing.
sentences.chinese: 这反映了我们观看一个公众人物道歉时的状态。

sentences.english: He wasshowferedchauffeured away soon thereafter with no public statement.
sentences.chinese: 他没对公众发表讲话就被车接走。

sentences.english: Meteorologists advised the public to wear face masks to ward off dust.
sentences.chinese: 气象学家建议公众外出时戴口罩。

sentences.english: First, is who you are or what you do that matters with respect to public perception?
sentences.chinese: 第一，公众的看法对于你是谁或你怎么做很重要吗？

sentences.english: This incident was not terrorist-related and there is no threat to the wider public.
sentences.chinese: 本事件与恐怖分子无关，不会对公众造成威胁。

sentences.english: The Archive lets the public upload or download digital material for free.
sentences.chinese: 这个档案馆允许公众免费上传和下载数字材料。

sentences.english: The demonstration was carefully orchestrated to attract maximum publicity.
sentences.chinese: 该示威经过精心策画以尽量吸引公众注重。

sentences.english: Growing restriction of the range of public information under the pressure of military secrecy.
sentences.chinese: 以保守军事机密为由对公众信息越来越多的限制。

sentences.english: The department is now collecting public comments on a number of negotiated rules.
sentences.chinese: 教育署目前正收集许多有关谈判规则的公众意见。

sentences.english: When completed , the museum will be open to the public next year.
sentences.chinese: 完工后，博物馆将在明年向公众开放。

sentences.english: While the masses need a platform to express their opinions or suggestions.
sentences.chinese: 而公众需要一个平台去表达他们的意见或建议。

sentences.english: Most of all, it received popular backing.
sentences.chinese: 最重要的是，它受到公众的支持。

sentences.english: The public have an insatiable appetite for scandal.
sentences.chinese: 公众对丑闻总是喜闻乐道。

sentences.english: Move the Window and you change the debate.
sentences.chinese: 移动这扇窗户你就能改变公众争论。

definition: the masses/the great bulk of the population/popular (of music, science etc)
proletariat/abbr. for 普羅列塔利亞|普罗列塔利亚[pu3 luo2 lie4 ta3 li4 ya4] plus masses/also written 無產階級|无产阶级[wu2 chan3 jie1 ji2] in PRC Marxist theory
to disseminate/to give publicity to/propaganda/CL:個|个[ge4]
to make known to the masses (idiom); to publicize widely/to let the world know
all walks of life/all social circles
to call on (sb to do sth)/to appeal (to)/an appeal
to expose/to unmask/to ferret out/to disclose/disclosure
